1 'use strict';
  2 
  3 var _ = require('underscore');
  4 
  5 // AV.Object is analogous to the Java AVObject.
  6 // It also implements the same interface as a Backbone model.
  7 
  8 module.exports = function(AV) {
  9   /**
 10    * Creates a new model with defined attributes. A client id (cid) is
 11    * automatically generated and assigned for you.
 12    *
 13    * <p>You won't normally call this method directly.  It is recommended that
 14    * you use a subclass of <code>AV.Object</code> instead, created by calling
 15    * <code>extend</code>.</p>
 16    *
 17    * <p>However, if you don't want to use a subclass, or aren't sure which
 18    * subclass is appropriate, you can use this form:<pre>
 19    *     var object = new AV.Object("ClassName");
 20    * </pre>
 21    * That is basically equivalent to:<pre>
 22    *     var MyClass = AV.Object.extend("ClassName");
 23    *     var object = new MyClass();
 24    * </pre></p>
 25    *
 26    * @param {Object} attributes The initial set of data to store in the object.
 27    * @param {Object} options A set of Backbone-like options for creating the
 28    *     object.  The only option currently supported is "collection".
 29    * @see AV.Object.extend
 30    *
 31    * @class
 32    *
 33    * <p>The fundamental unit of AV data, which implements the Backbone Model
 34    * interface.</p>
 35    */
 36   AV.Object = function(attributes, options) {
 37     // Allow new AV.Object("ClassName") as a shortcut to _create.
 38     if (_.isString(attributes)) {
 39       return AV.Object._create.apply(this, arguments);
 40     }
 41 
 42     attributes = attributes || {};
 43     if (options && options.parse) {
 44       attributes = this.parse(attributes);
 45     }
 46     var defaults = AV._getValue(this, 'defaults');
 47     if (defaults) {
 48       attributes = _.extend({}, defaults, attributes);
 49     }
 50     if (options && options.collection) {
 51       this.collection = options.collection;
 52     }
 53 
 54     this._serverData = {};  // The last known data for this object from cloud.
 55     this._opSetQueue = [{}];  // List of sets of changes to the data.
 56     this.attributes = {};  // The best estimate of this's current data.
 57 
 58     this._hashedJSON = {};  // Hash of values of containers at last save.
 59     this._escapedAttributes = {};
 60     this.cid = _.uniqueId('c');
 61     this.changed = {};
 62     this._silent = {};
 63     this._pending = {};
 64     if (!this.set(attributes, {silent: true})) {
 65       throw new Error("Can't create an invalid AV.Object");
 66     }
 67     this.changed = {};
 68     this._silent = {};
 69     this._pending = {};
 70     this._hasData = true;
 71     this._previousAttributes = _.clone(this.attributes);
 72     this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
 73   };
 74 
 75   /**
 76    * @lends AV.Object.prototype
 77    * @property {String} id The objectId of the AV Object.
 78    */
 79 
 80   /**
 81    * Saves the given list of AV.Object.
 82    * If any error is encountered, stops and calls the error handler.
 83    * There are two ways you can call this function.
 84    *
 85    * The Backbone way:<pre>
 86    *   AV.Object.saveAll([object1, object2, ...], {
 87    *     success: function(list) {
 88    *       // All the objects were saved.
 89    *     },
 90    *     error: function(error) {
 91    *       // An error occurred while saving one of the objects.
 92    *     },
 93    *   });
 94    * </pre>
 95    * A simplified syntax:<pre>
 96    *   AV.Object.saveAll([object1, object2, ...], function(list, error) {
 97    *     if (list) {
 98    *       // All the objects were saved.
 99    *     } else {
100    *       // An error occurred.
101    *     }
102    *   });
103    * </pre>
104    *
105    * @param {Array} list A list of <code>AV.Object</code>.
106    * @param {Object} options A Backbone-style callback object.
107    */
108   AV.Object.saveAll = function(list, options) {
109     return AV.Object._deepSaveAsync(list)._thenRunCallbacks(options);
110   };
111 
112   // Attach all inheritable methods to the AV.Object prototype.
113   _.extend(AV.Object.prototype, AV.Events,
114            /** @lends AV.Object.prototype */ {
115     _existed: false,
116     _fetchWhenSave: false,
117 
118     /**
119      * Initialize is an empty function by default. Override it with your own
120      * initialization logic.
121      */
122     initialize: function(){},
123 
124    /**
125      * Set whether to enable fetchWhenSave option when updating object.
126      * When set true, SDK would fetch the latest object after saving.
127      * Default is false.
128      * @param {boolean} enable  true to enable fetchWhenSave option.
129      */
130     fetchWhenSave: function(enable){
131       if (!_.isBoolean(enable)) {
132         throw "Expect boolean value for fetchWhenSave";
133       }
134       this._fetchWhenSave = enable;
135     },
136 
137    /**
138     * Returns the object's objectId.
139     * @return {String} the objectId.
140     */
141     getObjectId: function() {
142       return this.id;
143     },
144 
145    /**
146     * Returns the object's createdAt attribute.
147     * @return {Date}
148     */
149     getCreatedAt: function() {
150       return this.createdAt || this.get('createdAt');
151     },
152 
153    /**
154     * Returns the object's updatedAt attribute.
155     * @return {Date}
156     */
157     getUpdatedAt: function() {
158       return this.updatedAt || this.get('updatedAt');
159     },
160 
161     /**
162      * Returns a JSON version of the object suitable for saving to AV.
163      * @return {Object}
164      */
165     toJSON: function() {
166       var json = this._toFullJSON();
167       AV._arrayEach(["__type", "className"],
168                        function(key) { delete json[key]; });
169       return json;
170     },
171 
172     _toFullJSON: function(seenObjects) {
173       var json = _.clone(this.attributes);
174       AV._objectEach(json, function(val, key) {
175         json[key] = AV._encode(val, seenObjects);
176       });
177       AV._objectEach(this._operations, function(val, key) {
178         json[key] = val;
179       });
180 
181       if (_.has(this, "id")) {
182         json.objectId = this.id;
183       }
184       if (_.has(this, "createdAt")) {
185         if (_.isDate(this.createdAt)) {
186           json.createdAt = this.createdAt.toJSON();
187         } else {
188           json.createdAt = this.createdAt;
189         }
190       }
191 
192       if (_.has(this, "updatedAt")) {
193         if (_.isDate(this.updatedAt)) {
194           json.updatedAt = this.updatedAt.toJSON();
195         } else {
196           json.updatedAt = this.updatedAt;
197         }
198       }
199       json.__type = "Object";
200       json.className = this.className;
201       return json;
202     },
203 
204     /**
205      * Updates _hashedJSON to reflect the current state of this object.
206      * Adds any changed hash values to the set of pending changes.
207      */
208     _refreshCache: function() {
209       var self = this;
210       if (self._refreshingCache) {
211         return;
212       }
213       self._refreshingCache = true;
214       AV._objectEach(this.attributes, function(value, key) {
215         if (value instanceof AV.Object) {
216           value._refreshCache();
217         } else if (_.isObject(value)) {
218           if (self._resetCacheForKey(key)) {
219             self.set(key, new AV.Op.Set(value), { silent: true });
220           }
221         }
222       });
223       delete self._refreshingCache;
224     },
225 
226     /**
227      * Returns true if this object has been modified since its last
228      * save/refresh.  If an attribute is specified, it returns true only if that
229      * particular attribute has been modified since the last save/refresh.
230      * @param {String} attr An attribute name (optional).
231      * @return {Boolean}
232      */
233     dirty: function(attr) {
234       this._refreshCache();
235 
236       var currentChanges = _.last(this._opSetQueue);
237 
238       if (attr) {
239         return (currentChanges[attr] ? true : false);
240       }
241       if (!this.id) {
242         return true;
243       }
244       if (_.keys(currentChanges).length > 0) {
245         return true;
246       }
247       return false;
248     },
249 
250     /**
251      * Gets a Pointer referencing this Object.
252      */
253     _toPointer: function() {
254       // if (!this.id) {
255       //   throw new Error("Can't serialize an unsaved AV.Object");
256       // }
257       return { __type: "Pointer",
258                className: this.className,
259                objectId: this.id };
260     },
261 
262     /**
263      * Gets the value of an attribute.
264      * @param {String} attr The string name of an attribute.
265      */
266     get: function(attr) {
267       return this.attributes[attr];
268     },
269 
270     /**
271      * Gets a relation on the given class for the attribute.
272      * @param String attr The attribute to get the relation for.
273      */
274     relation: function(attr) {
275       var value = this.get(attr);
276       if (value) {
277         if (!(value instanceof AV.Relation)) {
278           throw "Called relation() on non-relation field " + attr;
279         }
280         value._ensureParentAndKey(this, attr);
281         return value;
282       } else {
283         return new AV.Relation(this, attr);
284       }
285     },
286 
287     /**
288      * Gets the HTML-escaped value of an attribute.
289      */
290     escape: function(attr) {
291       var html = this._escapedAttributes[attr];
292       if (html) {
293         return html;
294       }
295       var val = this.attributes[attr];
296       var escaped;
297       if (AV._isNullOrUndefined(val)) {
298         escaped = '';
299       } else {
300         escaped = _.escape(val.toString());
301       }
302       this._escapedAttributes[attr] = escaped;
303       return escaped;
304     },
305 
306     /**
307      * Returns <code>true</code> if the attribute contains a value that is not
308      * null or undefined.
309      * @param {String} attr The string name of the attribute.
310      * @return {Boolean}
311      */
312     has: function(attr) {
313       return !AV._isNullOrUndefined(this.attributes[attr]);
314     },
315 
316     /**
317      * Pulls "special" fields like objectId, createdAt, etc. out of attrs
318      * and puts them on "this" directly.  Removes them from attrs.
319      * @param attrs - A dictionary with the data for this AV.Object.
320      */
321     _mergeMagicFields: function(attrs) {
322       // Check for changes of magic fields.
323       var model = this;
324       var specialFields = ["id", "objectId", "createdAt", "updatedAt"];
325       AV._arrayEach(specialFields, function(attr) {
326         if (attrs[attr]) {
327           if (attr === "objectId") {
328             model.id = attrs[attr];
329           } else if ((attr === "createdAt" || attr === "updatedAt") &&
330                      !_.isDate(attrs[attr])) {
331             model[attr] = AV._parseDate(attrs[attr]);
332           } else {
333             model[attr] = attrs[attr];
334           }
335           delete attrs[attr];
336         }
337       });
338     },
339 
340     /**
341      * Returns the json to be sent to the server.
342      */
343     _startSave: function() {
344       this._opSetQueue.push({});
345     },
346 
347     /**
348      * Called when a save fails because of an error. Any changes that were part
349      * of the save need to be merged with changes made after the save. This
350      * might throw an exception is you do conflicting operations. For example,
351      * if you do:
352      *   object.set("foo", "bar");
353      *   object.set("invalid field name", "baz");
354      *   object.save();
355      *   object.increment("foo");
356      * then this will throw when the save fails and the client tries to merge
357      * "bar" with the +1.
358      */
359     _cancelSave: function() {
360       var self = this;
361       var failedChanges = _.first(this._opSetQueue);
362       this._opSetQueue = _.rest(this._opSetQueue);
363       var nextChanges = _.first(this._opSetQueue);
364       AV._objectEach(failedChanges, function(op, key) {
365         var op1 = failedChanges[key];
366         var op2 = nextChanges[key];
367         if (op1 && op2) {
368           nextChanges[key] = op2._mergeWithPrevious(op1);
369         } else if (op1) {
370           nextChanges[key] = op1;
371         }
372       });
373       this._saving = this._saving - 1;
374     },
375 
376     /**
377      * Called when a save completes successfully. This merges the changes that
378      * were saved into the known server data, and overrides it with any data
379      * sent directly from the server.
380      */
381     _finishSave: function(serverData) {
382       // Grab a copy of any object referenced by this object. These instances
383       // may have already been fetched, and we don't want to lose their data.
384       // Note that doing it like this means we will unify separate copies of the
385       // same object, but that's a risk we have to take.
386       var fetchedObjects = {};
387       AV._traverse(this.attributes, function(object) {
388         if (object instanceof AV.Object && object.id && object._hasData) {
389           fetchedObjects[object.id] = object;
390         }
391       });
392 
393       var savedChanges = _.first(this._opSetQueue);
394       this._opSetQueue = _.rest(this._opSetQueue);
395       this._applyOpSet(savedChanges, this._serverData);
396       this._mergeMagicFields(serverData);
397       var self = this;
398       AV._objectEach(serverData, function(value, key) {
399         self._serverData[key] = AV._decode(key, value);
400 
401         // Look for any objects that might have become unfetched and fix them
402         // by replacing their values with the previously observed values.
403         var fetched = AV._traverse(self._serverData[key], function(object) {
404           if (object instanceof AV.Object && fetchedObjects[object.id]) {
405             return fetchedObjects[object.id];
406           }
407         });
408         if (fetched) {
409           self._serverData[key] = fetched;
410         }
411       });
412       this._rebuildAllEstimatedData();
413       this._saving = this._saving - 1;
414     },
415 
416     /**
417      * Called when a fetch or login is complete to set the known server data to
418      * the given object.
419      */
420     _finishFetch: function(serverData, hasData) {
421       // Clear out any changes the user might have made previously.
422       this._opSetQueue = [{}];
423 
424       // Bring in all the new server data.
425       this._mergeMagicFields(serverData);
426       var self = this;
427       AV._objectEach(serverData, function(value, key) {
428         self._serverData[key] = AV._decode(key, value);
429       });
430 
431       // Refresh the attributes.
432       this._rebuildAllEstimatedData();
433 
434       // Clear out the cache of mutable containers.
435       this._refreshCache();
436       this._opSetQueue = [{}];
437 
438       this._hasData = hasData;
439     },
440 
441     /**
442      * Applies the set of AV.Op in opSet to the object target.
443      */
444     _applyOpSet: function(opSet, target) {
445       var self = this;
446       AV._objectEach(opSet, function(change, key) {
447         target[key] = change._estimate(target[key], self, key);
448         if (target[key] === AV.Op._UNSET) {
449           delete target[key];
450         }
451       });
452     },
453 
454     /**
455      * Replaces the cached value for key with the current value.
456      * Returns true if the new value is different than the old value.
457      */
458     _resetCacheForKey: function(key) {
459       var value = this.attributes[key];
460       if (_.isObject(value) &&
461           !(value instanceof AV.Object) &&
462           !(value instanceof AV.File)) {
463 
464         value = value.toJSON ? value.toJSON() : value;
465         var json = JSON.stringify(value);
466         if (this._hashedJSON[key] !== json) {
467           var wasSet = !! this._hashedJSON[key];
468           this._hashedJSON[key] = json;
469           return wasSet;
470         }
471       }
472       return false;
473     },
474 
475     /**
476      * Populates attributes[key] by starting with the last known data from the
477      * server, and applying all of the local changes that have been made to that
478      * key since then.
479      */
480     _rebuildEstimatedDataForKey: function(key) {
481       var self = this;
482       delete this.attributes[key];
483       if (this._serverData[key]) {
484         this.attributes[key] = this._serverData[key];
485       }
486       AV._arrayEach(this._opSetQueue, function(opSet) {
487         var op = opSet[key];
488         if (op) {
489           self.attributes[key] = op._estimate(self.attributes[key], self, key);
490           if (self.attributes[key] === AV.Op._UNSET) {
491             delete self.attributes[key];
492           } else {
493             self._resetCacheForKey(key);
494           }
495         }
496       });
497     },
498 
499     /**
500      * Populates attributes by starting with the last known data from the
501      * server, and applying all of the local changes that have been made since
502      * then.
503      */
504     _rebuildAllEstimatedData: function() {
505       var self = this;
506 
507       var previousAttributes = _.clone(this.attributes);
508 
509       this.attributes = _.clone(this._serverData);
510       AV._arrayEach(this._opSetQueue, function(opSet) {
511         self._applyOpSet(opSet, self.attributes);
512         AV._objectEach(opSet, function(op, key) {
513           self._resetCacheForKey(key);
514         });
515       });
516 
517       // Trigger change events for anything that changed because of the fetch.
518       AV._objectEach(previousAttributes, function(oldValue, key) {
519         if (self.attributes[key] !== oldValue) {
520           self.trigger('change:' + key, self, self.attributes[key], {});
521         }
522       });
523       AV._objectEach(this.attributes, function(newValue, key) {
524         if (!_.has(previousAttributes, key)) {
525           self.trigger('change:' + key, self, newValue, {});
526         }
527       });
528     },
529 
530     /**
531      * Sets a hash of model attributes on the object, firing
532      * <code>"change"</code> unless you choose to silence it.
533      *
534      * <p>You can call it with an object containing keys and values, or with one
535      * key and value.  For example:<pre>
536      *   gameTurn.set({
537      *     player: player1,
538      *     diceRoll: 2
539      *   }, {
540      *     error: function(gameTurnAgain, error) {
541      *       // The set failed validation.
542      *     }
543      *   });
544      *
545      *   game.set("currentPlayer", player2, {
546      *     error: function(gameTurnAgain, error) {
547      *       // The set failed validation.
548      *     }
549      *   });
550      *
551      *   game.set("finished", true);</pre></p>
552      *
553      * @param {String} key The key to set.
554      * @param {} value The value to give it.
555      * @param {Object} options A set of Backbone-like options for the set.
556      *     The only supported options are <code>silent</code>,
557      *     <code>error</code>, and <code>promise</code>.
558      * @return {Boolean} true if the set succeeded.
559      * @see AV.Object#validate
560      * @see AV.Error
561      */
562     set: function(key, value, options) {
563       var attrs, attr;
564       if (_.isObject(key) || AV._isNullOrUndefined(key)) {
565         attrs = key;
566         AV._objectEach(attrs, function(v, k) {
567           attrs[k] = AV._decode(k, v);
568         });
569         options = value;
570       } else {
571         attrs = {};
572         attrs[key] = AV._decode(key, value);
573       }
574 
575       // Extract attributes and options.
576       options = options || {};
577       if (!attrs) {
578         return this;
579       }
580       if (attrs instanceof AV.Object) {
581         attrs = attrs.attributes;
582       }
583 
584       // If the unset option is used, every attribute should be a Unset.
585       if (options.unset) {
586         AV._objectEach(attrs, function(unused_value, key) {
587           attrs[key] = new AV.Op.Unset();
588         });
589       }
590 
591       // Apply all the attributes to get the estimated values.
592       var dataToValidate = _.clone(attrs);
593       var self = this;
594       AV._objectEach(dataToValidate, function(value, key) {
595         if (value instanceof AV.Op) {
596           dataToValidate[key] = value._estimate(self.attributes[key],
597                                                 self, key);
598           if (dataToValidate[key] === AV.Op._UNSET) {
599             delete dataToValidate[key];
600           }
601         }
602       });
603 
604       // Run validation.
605       if (!this._validate(attrs, options)) {
606         return false;
607       }
608 
609       this._mergeMagicFields(attrs);
610 
611       options.changes = {};
612       var escaped = this._escapedAttributes;
613       var prev = this._previousAttributes || {};
614 
615       // Update attributes.
616       AV._arrayEach(_.keys(attrs), function(attr) {
617         var val = attrs[attr];
618 
619         // If this is a relation object we need to set the parent correctly,
620         // since the location where it was parsed does not have access to
621         // this object.
622         if (val instanceof AV.Relation) {
623           val.parent = self;
624         }
625 
626         if (!(val instanceof AV.Op)) {
627           val = new AV.Op.Set(val);
628         }
629 
630         // See if this change will actually have any effect.
631         var isRealChange = true;
632         if (val instanceof AV.Op.Set &&
633             _.isEqual(self.attributes[attr], val.value)) {
634           isRealChange = false;
635         }
636 
637         if (isRealChange) {
638           delete escaped[attr];
639           if (options.silent) {
640             self._silent[attr] = true;
641           } else {
642             options.changes[attr] = true;
643           }
644         }
645 
646         var currentChanges = _.last(self._opSetQueue);
647         currentChanges[attr] = val._mergeWithPrevious(currentChanges[attr]);
648         self._rebuildEstimatedDataForKey(attr);
649 
650         if (isRealChange) {
651           self.changed[attr] = self.attributes[attr];
652           if (!options.silent) {
653             self._pending[attr] = true;
654           }
655         } else {
656           delete self.changed[attr];
657           delete self._pending[attr];
658         }
659       });
660 
661       if (!options.silent) {
662         this.change(options);
663       }
664       return this;
665     },
666 
667     /**
668      * Remove an attribute from the model, firing <code>"change"</code> unless
669      * you choose to silence it. This is a noop if the attribute doesn't
670      * exist.
671      */
672     unset: function(attr, options) {
673       options = options || {};
674       options.unset = true;
675       return this.set(attr, null, options);
676     },
677 
678     /**
679      * Atomically increments the value of the given attribute the next time the
680      * object is saved. If no amount is specified, 1 is used by default.
681      *
682      * @param attr {String} The key.
683      * @param amount {Number} The amount to increment by.
684      */
685     increment: function(attr, amount) {
686       if (_.isUndefined(amount) || _.isNull(amount)) {
687         amount = 1;
688       }
689       return this.set(attr, new AV.Op.Increment(amount));
690     },
691 
692     /**
693      * Atomically add an object to the end of the array associated with a given
694      * key.
695      * @param attr {String} The key.
696      * @param item {} The item to add.
697      */
698     add: function(attr, item) {
699       return this.set(attr, new AV.Op.Add([item]));
700     },
701 
702     /**
703      * Atomically add an object to the array associated with a given key, only
704      * if it is not already present in the array. The position of the insert is
705      * not guaranteed.
706      *
707      * @param attr {String} The key.
708      * @param item {} The object to add.
709      */
710     addUnique: function(attr, item) {
711       return this.set(attr, new AV.Op.AddUnique([item]));
712     },
713 
714     /**
715      * Atomically remove all instances of an object from the array associated
716      * with a given key.
717      *
718      * @param attr {String} The key.
719      * @param item {} The object to remove.
720      */
721     remove: function(attr, item) {
722       return this.set(attr, new AV.Op.Remove([item]));
723     },
724 
725     /**
726      * Returns an instance of a subclass of AV.Op describing what kind of
727      * modification has been performed on this field since the last time it was
728      * saved. For example, after calling object.increment("x"), calling
729      * object.op("x") would return an instance of AV.Op.Increment.
730      *
731      * @param attr {String} The key.
732      * @returns {AV.Op} The operation, or undefined if none.
733      */
734     op: function(attr) {
735       return _.last(this._opSetQueue)[attr];
736     },
737 
738     /**
739      * Clear all attributes on the model, firing <code>"change"</code> unless
740      * you choose to silence it.
741      */
742     clear: function(options) {
743       options = options || {};
744       options.unset = true;
745       var keysToClear = _.extend(this.attributes, this._operations);
746       return this.set(keysToClear, options);
747     },
748 
749     /**
750      * Returns a JSON-encoded set of operations to be sent with the next save
751      * request.
752      */
753     _getSaveJSON: function() {
754       var json = _.clone(_.first(this._opSetQueue));
755       AV._objectEach(json, function(op, key) {
756         json[key] = op.toJSON();
757       });
758       return json;
759     },
760 
761     /**
762      * Returns true if this object can be serialized for saving.
763      */
764     _canBeSerialized: function() {
765       return AV.Object._canBeSerializedAsValue(this.attributes);
766     },
767 
768     /**
769      * Fetch the model from the server. If the server's representation of the
770      * model differs from its current attributes, they will be overriden,
771      * triggering a <code>"change"</code> event.
772      * @param {Object} fetchOptions Optional options to set 'keys' and
773      *      'include' option.
774      * @param {Object} options Optional Backbone-like options object to be
775      *     passed in to set.
776      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the fetch
777      *     completes.
778      */
779     fetch: function() {
780       var options = null;
781       var fetchOptions = {};
782       if(arguments.length === 1) {
783         options = arguments[0];
784       } else if(arguments.length === 2) {
785         fetchOptions = arguments[0];
786         options = arguments[1];
787       }
788 
789       var self = this;
790       var request = AV._request("classes", this.className, this.id, 'GET',
791                                 fetchOptions);
792       return request.then(function(response, status, xhr) {
793         self._finishFetch(self.parse(response, status, xhr), true);
794         return self;
795       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
796     },
797 
798     /**
799      * Set a hash of model attributes, and save the model to the server.
800      * updatedAt will be updated when the request returns.
801      * You can either call it as:<pre>
802      *   object.save();</pre>
803      * or<pre>
804      *   object.save(null, options);</pre>
805      * or<pre>
806      *   object.save(attrs, options);</pre>
807      * or<pre>
808      *   object.save(key, value, options);</pre>
809      *
810      * For example, <pre>
811      *   gameTurn.save({
812      *     player: "Jake Cutter",
813      *     diceRoll: 2
814      *   }, {
815      *     success: function(gameTurnAgain) {
816      *       // The save was successful.
817      *     },
818      *     error: function(gameTurnAgain, error) {
819      *       // The save failed.  Error is an instance of AV.Error.
820      *     }
821      *   });</pre>
822      * or with promises:<pre>
823      *   gameTurn.save({
824      *     player: "Jake Cutter",
825      *     diceRoll: 2
826      *   }).then(function(gameTurnAgain) {
827      *     // The save was successful.
828      *   }, function(error) {
829      *     // The save failed.  Error is an instance of AV.Error.
830      *   });</pre>
831      *
832      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the save
833      *     completes.
834      * @see AV.Error
835      */
836     save: function(arg1, arg2, arg3) {
837       var i, attrs, current, options, saved;
838       if (_.isObject(arg1) || AV._isNullOrUndefined(arg1)) {
839         attrs = arg1;
840         options = arg2;
841       } else {
842         attrs = {};
843         attrs[arg1] = arg2;
844         options = arg3;
845       }
846 
847       // Make save({ success: function() {} }) work.
848       if (!options && attrs) {
849         var extra_keys = _.reject(attrs, function(value, key) {
850           return _.include(["success", "error", "wait"], key);
851         });
852         if (extra_keys.length === 0) {
853           var all_functions = true;
854           if (_.has(attrs, "success") && !_.isFunction(attrs.success)) {
855             all_functions = false;
856           }
857           if (_.has(attrs, "error") && !_.isFunction(attrs.error)) {
858             all_functions = false;
859           }
860           if (all_functions) {
861             // This attrs object looks like it's really an options object,
862             // and there's no other options object, so let's just use it.
863             return this.save(null, attrs);
864           }
865         }
866       }
867 
868       options = _.clone(options) || {};
869       if (options.wait) {
870         current = _.clone(this.attributes);
871       }
872 
873       var setOptions = _.clone(options) || {};
874       if (setOptions.wait) {
875         setOptions.silent = true;
876       }
877       var setError;
878       setOptions.error = function(model, error) {
879         setError = error;
880       };
881       if (attrs && !this.set(attrs, setOptions)) {
882         return AV.Promise.error(setError)._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
883       }
884 
885       var model = this;
886 
887       // If there is any unsaved child, save it first.
888       model._refreshCache();
889 
890 
891 
892       var unsavedChildren = [];
893       var unsavedFiles = [];
894       AV.Object._findUnsavedChildren(model.attributes,
895                                         unsavedChildren,
896                                         unsavedFiles);
897       if (unsavedChildren.length + unsavedFiles.length > 0) {
898         return AV.Object._deepSaveAsync(this.attributes, model).then(function() {
899           return model.save(null, options);
900         }, function(error) {
901           return AV.Promise.error(error)._thenRunCallbacks(options, model);
902         });
903       }
904 
905       this._startSave();
906       this._saving = (this._saving || 0) + 1;
907 
908       this._allPreviousSaves = this._allPreviousSaves || AV.Promise.as();
909       this._allPreviousSaves = this._allPreviousSaves._continueWith(function() {
910         var method = model.id ? 'PUT' : 'POST';
911 
912         var json = model._getSaveJSON();
913 
914         if(model._fetchWhenSave){
915           //Sepcial-case fetchWhenSave when updating object.
916           json._fetchWhenSave = true;
917         }
918 
919         var route = "classes";
920         var className = model.className;
921         if (model.className === "_User" && !model.id) {
922           // Special-case user sign-up.
923           route = "users";
924           className = null;
925         }
926         //hook makeRequest in options.
927         var makeRequest = options._makeRequest || AV._request;
928         var request = makeRequest(route, className, model.id, method, json);
929 
930         request = request.then(function(resp, status, xhr) {
931           var serverAttrs = model.parse(resp, status, xhr);
932           if (options.wait) {
933             serverAttrs = _.extend(attrs || {}, serverAttrs);
934           }
935           model._finishSave(serverAttrs);
936           if (options.wait) {
937             model.set(current, setOptions);
938           }
939           return model;
940 
941         }, function(error) {
942           model._cancelSave();
943           return AV.Promise.error(error);
944 
945         })._thenRunCallbacks(options, model);
946 
947         return request;
948       });
949       return this._allPreviousSaves;
950     },
951 
952     /**
953      * Destroy this model on the server if it was already persisted.
954      * Optimistically removes the model from its collection, if it has one.
955      * If `wait: true` is passed, waits for the server to respond
956      * before removal.
957      *
958      * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the destroy
959      *     completes.
960      */
961     destroy: function(options) {
962       options = options || {};
963       var model = this;
964 
965       var triggerDestroy = function() {
966         model.trigger('destroy', model, model.collection, options);
967       };
968 
969       if (!this.id) {
970         return triggerDestroy();
971       }
972 
973       if (!options.wait) {
974         triggerDestroy();
975       }
976 
977       var request =
978           AV._request("classes", this.className, this.id, 'DELETE');
979       return request.then(function() {
980         if (options.wait) {
981           triggerDestroy();
982         }
983         return model;
984       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
985     },
986 
987     /**
988      * Converts a response into the hash of attributes to be set on the model.
989      * @ignore
990      */
991     parse: function(resp, status, xhr) {
992       var output = _.clone(resp);
993       _(["createdAt", "updatedAt"]).each(function(key) {
994         if (output[key]) {
995           output[key] = AV._parseDate(output[key]);
996         }
997       });
998       if (!output.updatedAt) {
999         output.updatedAt = output.createdAt;
1000       }
1001       if (status) {
1002         this._existed = (status !== 201);
1003       }
1004       return output;
1005     },
1006 
1007     /**
1008      * Creates a new model with identical attributes to this one.
1009      * @return {AV.Object}
1010      */
1011     clone: function() {
1012       return new this.constructor(this.attributes);
1013     },
1014 
1015     /**
1016      * Returns true if this object has never been saved to AV.
1017      * @return {Boolean}
1018      */
1019     isNew: function() {
1020       return !this.id;
1021     },
1022 
1023     /**
1024      * Call this method to manually fire a `"change"` event for this model and
1025      * a `"change:attribute"` event for each changed attribute.
1026      * Calling this will cause all objects observing the model to update.
1027      */
1028     change: function(options) {
1029       options = options || {};
1030       var changing = this._changing;
1031       this._changing = true;
1032 
1033       // Silent changes become pending changes.
1034       var self = this;
1035       AV._objectEach(this._silent, function(attr) {
1036         self._pending[attr] = true;
1037       });
1038 
1039       // Silent changes are triggered.
1040       var changes = _.extend({}, options.changes, this._silent);
1041       this._silent = {};
1042       AV._objectEach(changes, function(unused_value, attr) {
1043         self.trigger('change:' + attr, self, self.get(attr), options);
1044       });
1045       if (changing) {
1046         return this;
1047       }
1048 
1049       // This is to get around lint not letting us make a function in a loop.
1050       var deleteChanged = function(value, attr) {
1051         if (!self._pending[attr] && !self._silent[attr]) {
1052           delete self.changed[attr];
1053         }
1054       };
1055 
1056       // Continue firing `"change"` events while there are pending changes.
1057       while (!_.isEmpty(this._pending)) {
1058         this._pending = {};
1059         this.trigger('change', this, options);
1060         // Pending and silent changes still remain.
1061         AV._objectEach(this.changed, deleteChanged);
1062         self._previousAttributes = _.clone(this.attributes);
1063       }
1064 
1065       this._changing = false;
1066       return this;
1067     },
1068 
1069     /**
1070      * Returns true if this object was created by the AV server when the
1071      * object might have already been there (e.g. in the case of a Facebook
1072      * login)
1073      */
1074     existed: function() {
1075       return this._existed;
1076     },
1077 
1078     /**
1079      * Determine if the model has changed since the last <code>"change"</code>
1080      * event.  If you specify an attribute name, determine if that attribute
1081      * has changed.
1082      * @param {String} attr Optional attribute name
1083      * @return {Boolean}
1084      */
1085     hasChanged: function(attr) {
1086       if (!arguments.length) {
1087         return !_.isEmpty(this.changed);
1088       }
1089       return this.changed && _.has(this.changed, attr);
1090     },
1091 
1092     /**
1093      * Returns an object containing all the attributes that have changed, or
1094      * false if there are no changed attributes. Useful for determining what
1095      * parts of a view need to be updated and/or what attributes need to be
1096      * persisted to the server. Unset attributes will be set to undefined.
1097      * You can also pass an attributes object to diff against the model,
1098      * determining if there *would be* a change.
1099      */
1100     changedAttributes: function(diff) {
1101       if (!diff) {
1102         return this.hasChanged() ? _.clone(this.changed) : false;
1103       }
1104       var changed = {};
1105       var old = this._previousAttributes;
1106       AV._objectEach(diff, function(diffVal, attr) {
1107         if (!_.isEqual(old[attr], diffVal)) {
1108           changed[attr] = diffVal;
1109         }
1110       });
1111       return changed;
1112     },
1113 
1114     /**
1115      * Gets the previous value of an attribute, recorded at the time the last
1116      * <code>"change"</code> event was fired.
1117      * @param {String} attr Name of the attribute to get.
1118      */
1119     previous: function(attr) {
1120       if (!arguments.length || !this._previousAttributes) {
1121         return null;
1122       }
1123       return this._previousAttributes[attr];
1124     },
1125 
1126     /**
1127      * Gets all of the attributes of the model at the time of the previous
1128      * <code>"change"</code> event.
1129      * @return {Object}
1130      */
1131     previousAttributes: function() {
1132       return _.clone(this._previousAttributes);
1133     },
1134 
1135     /**
1136      * Checks if the model is currently in a valid state. It's only possible to
1137      * get into an *invalid* state if you're using silent changes.
1138      * @return {Boolean}
1139      */
1140     isValid: function() {
1141       return !this.validate(this.attributes);
1142     },
1143 
1144     /**
1145      * You should not call this function directly unless you subclass
1146      * <code>AV.Object</code>, in which case you can override this method
1147      * to provide additional validation on <code>set</code> and
1148      * <code>save</code>.  Your implementation should return
1149      *
1150      * @param {Object} attrs The current data to validate.
1151      * @param {Object} options A Backbone-like options object.
1152      * @return {} False if the data is valid.  An error object otherwise.
1153      * @see AV.Object#set
1154      */
1155     validate: function(attrs, options) {
1156       if (_.has(attrs, "ACL") && !(attrs.ACL instanceof AV.ACL)) {
1157         return new AV.Error(AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
1158                                "ACL must be a AV.ACL.");
1159       }
1160       return false;
1161     },
1162 
1163     /**
1164      * Run validation against a set of incoming attributes, returning `true`
1165      * if all is well. If a specific `error` callback has been passed,
1166      * call that instead of firing the general `"error"` event.
1167      */
1168     _validate: function(attrs, options) {
1169       if (options.silent || !this.validate) {
1170         return true;
1171       }
1172       attrs = _.extend({}, this.attributes, attrs);
1173       var error = this.validate(attrs, options);
1174       if (!error) {
1175         return true;
1176       }
1177       if (options && options.error) {
1178         options.error(this, error, options);
1179       } else {
1180         this.trigger('error', this, error, options);
1181       }
1182       return false;
1183     },
1184 
1185     /**
1186      * Returns the ACL for this object.
1187      * @returns {AV.ACL} An instance of AV.ACL.
1188      * @see AV.Object#get
1189      */
1190     getACL: function() {
1191       return this.get("ACL");
1192     },
1193 
1194     /**
1195      * Sets the ACL to be used for this object.
1196      * @param {AV.ACL} acl An instance of AV.ACL.
1197      * @param {Object} options Optional Backbone-like options object to be
1198      *     passed in to set.
1199      * @return {Boolean} Whether the set passed validation.
1200      * @see AV.Object#set
1201      */
1202     setACL: function(acl, options) {
1203       return this.set("ACL", acl, options);
1204     }
1205 
1206   });
1207 
1208    /**
1209     * Creates an instance of a subclass of AV.Object for the give classname
1210     * and id.
1211     * @param  {String} className The name of the AV class backing this model.
1212     * @param {String} id The object id of this model.
1213     * @return {AV.Object} A new subclass instance of AV.Object.
1214     */
1215    AV.Object.createWithoutData = function(className, id, hasData){
1216      var result = new AV.Object(className);
1217      result.id = id;
1218      result._hasData = hasData;
1219      return result;
1220    };
1221    /**
1222     * Delete objects in batch.The objects className must be the same.
1223     * @param {Array} The ParseObject array to be deleted.
1224     * @param {Object} options Standard options object with success and error
1225     *     callbacks.
1226     * @return {AV.Promise} A promise that is fulfilled when the save
1227     *     completes.
1228     */
1229    AV.Object.destroyAll = function(objects, options){
1230       if(objects == null || objects.length == 0){
1231 		  return AV.Promise.as()._thenRunCallbacks(options);
1232       }
1233       var className = objects[0].className;
1234       var id = "";
1235       var wasFirst = true;
1236       objects.forEach(function(obj){
1237         if(obj.className != className)
1238 			  throw "AV.Object.destroyAll requires the argument object array's classNames must be the same";
1239           if(!obj.id)
1240               throw "Could not delete unsaved object";
1241           if(wasFirst){
1242               id = obj.id;
1243               wasFirst = false;
1244           }else{
1245               id = id + ',' + obj.id;
1246           }
1247       });
1248       var request =
1249           AV._request("classes", className, id, 'DELETE');
1250       return request._thenRunCallbacks(options);
1251    };
1252 
1253   /**
1254    * Returns the appropriate subclass for making new instances of the given
1255    * className string.
1256    */
1257   AV.Object._getSubclass = function(className) {
1258     if (!_.isString(className)) {
1259       throw "AV.Object._getSubclass requires a string argument.";
1260     }
1261     var ObjectClass = AV.Object._classMap[className];
1262     if (!ObjectClass) {
1263       ObjectClass = AV.Object.extend(className);
1264       AV.Object._classMap[className] = ObjectClass;
1265     }
1266     return ObjectClass;
1267   };
1268 
1269   /**
1270    * Creates an instance of a subclass of AV.Object for the given classname.
1271    */
1272   AV.Object._create = function(className, attributes, options) {
1273     var ObjectClass = AV.Object._getSubclass(className);
1274     return new ObjectClass(attributes, options);
1275   };
1276 
1277   // Set up a map of className to class so that we can create new instances of
1278   // AV Objects from JSON automatically.
1279   AV.Object._classMap = {};
1280 
1281   AV.Object._extend = AV._extend;
1282 
1283   /**
1284    * Creates a new model with defined attributes,
1285    * It's the same with
1286    * <pre>
1287    *   new AV.Object(attributes, options);
1288    *  </pre>
1289    * @param {Object} attributes The initial set of data to store in the object.
1290    * @param {Object} options A set of Backbone-like options for creating the
1291    *     object.  The only option currently supported is "collection".
1292    * @return {AV.Object}
1293    * @since v0.4.4
1294    * @see AV.Object
1295    * @see AV.Object.extend
1296    */
1297   AV.Object.new = function(attributes, options){
1298     return new AV.Object(attributes, options);
1299   };
1300 
1301   /**
1302    * Creates a new subclass of AV.Object for the given AV class name.
1303    *
1304    * <p>Every extension of a AV class will inherit from the most recent
1305    * previous extension of that class. When a AV.Object is automatically
1306    * created by parsing JSON, it will use the most recent extension of that
1307    * class.</p>
1308    *
1309    * <p>You should call either:<pre>
1310    *     var MyClass = AV.Object.extend("MyClass", {
1311    *         <i>Instance properties</i>
1312    *     }, {
1313    *         <i>Class properties</i>
1314    *     });</pre>
1315    * or, for Backbone compatibility:<pre>
1316    *     var MyClass = AV.Object.extend({
1317    *         className: "MyClass",
1318    *         <i>Other instance properties</i>
1319    *     }, {
1320    *         <i>Class properties</i>
1321    *     });</pre></p>
1322    *
1323    * @param {String} className The name of the AV class backing this model.
1324    * @param {Object} protoProps Instance properties to add to instances of the
1325    *     class returned from this method.
1326    * @param {Object} classProps Class properties to add the class returned from
1327    *     this method.
1328    * @return {Class} A new subclass of AV.Object.
1329    */
1330   AV.Object.extend = function(className, protoProps, classProps) {
1331     // Handle the case with only two args.
1332     if (!_.isString(className)) {
1333       if (className && _.has(className, "className")) {
1334         return AV.Object.extend(className.className, className, protoProps);
1335       } else {
1336         throw new Error(
1337             "AV.Object.extend's first argument should be the className.");
1338       }
1339     }
1340 
1341     // If someone tries to subclass "User", coerce it to the right type.
1342     if (className === "User") {
1343       className = "_User";
1344     }
1345 
1346     var NewClassObject = null;
1347     if (_.has(AV.Object._classMap, className)) {
1348       var OldClassObject = AV.Object._classMap[className];
1349       // This new subclass has been told to extend both from "this" and from
1350       // OldClassObject. This is multiple inheritance, which isn't supported.
1351       // For now, let's just pick one.
1352       NewClassObject = OldClassObject._extend(protoProps, classProps);
1353     } else {
1354       protoProps = protoProps || {};
1355       protoProps.className = className;
1356       NewClassObject = this._extend(protoProps, classProps);
1357     }
1358     // Extending a subclass should reuse the classname automatically.
1359     NewClassObject.extend = function(arg0) {
1360       if (_.isString(arg0) || (arg0 && _.has(arg0, "className"))) {
1361         return AV.Object.extend.apply(NewClassObject, arguments);
1362       }
1363       var newArguments = [className].concat(AV._.toArray(arguments));
1364       return AV.Object.extend.apply(NewClassObject, newArguments);
1365     };
1366     NewClassObject.new = function(attributes, options){
1367       return new NewClassObject(attributes, options);
1368     };
1369     AV.Object._classMap[className] = NewClassObject;
1370     return NewClassObject;
1371   };
1372 
1373   AV.Object._findUnsavedChildren = function(object, children, files) {
1374     AV._traverse(object, function(object) {
1375       if (object instanceof AV.Object) {
1376         object._refreshCache();
1377         if (object.dirty()) {
1378           children.push(object);
1379         }
1380         return;
1381       }
1382 
1383       if (object instanceof AV.File) {
1384         if (!object.url() && !object.id) {
1385           files.push(object);
1386         }
1387         return;
1388       }
1389     });
1390   };
1391 
1392   AV.Object._canBeSerializedAsValue = function(object) {
1393     var canBeSerializedAsValue = true;
1394 
1395     if (object instanceof AV.Object || object instanceof AV.File) {
1396       canBeSerializedAsValue = !!object.id;
1397 
1398     } else if (_.isArray(object)) {
1399       AV._arrayEach(object, function(child) {
1400         if (!AV.Object._canBeSerializedAsValue(child)) {
1401           canBeSerializedAsValue = false;
1402         }
1403       });
1404 
1405     } else if (_.isObject(object)) {
1406       AV._objectEach(object, function(child) {
1407         if (!AV.Object._canBeSerializedAsValue(child)) {
1408           canBeSerializedAsValue = false;
1409         }
1410       });
1411     }
1412 
1413     return canBeSerializedAsValue;
1414   };
1415 
1416   AV.Object._deepSaveAsync = function(object, model) {
1417     var unsavedChildren = [];
1418     var unsavedFiles = [];
1419     AV.Object._findUnsavedChildren(object, unsavedChildren, unsavedFiles);
1420     if(model) {
1421       unsavedChildren = _.filter(unsavedChildren, function(object) {
1422         return object != model;
1423       });
1424     }
1425 
1426     var promise = AV.Promise.as();
1427     _.each(unsavedFiles, function(file) {
1428       promise = promise.then(function() {
1429         return file.save();
1430       });
1431     });
1432 
1433     var objects = _.uniq(unsavedChildren);
1434     var remaining = _.uniq(objects);
1435 
1436     return promise.then(function() {
1437       return AV.Promise._continueWhile(function() {
1438         return remaining.length > 0;
1439       }, function() {
1440 
1441         // Gather up all the objects that can be saved in this batch.
1442         var batch = [];
1443         var newRemaining = [];
1444         AV._arrayEach(remaining, function(object) {
1445           // Limit batches to 20 objects.
1446           if (batch.length > 20) {
1447             newRemaining.push(object);
1448             return;
1449           }
1450 
1451           if (object._canBeSerialized()) {
1452             batch.push(object);
1453           } else {
1454             newRemaining.push(object);
1455           }
1456         });
1457         remaining = newRemaining;
1458 
1459         // If we can't save any objects, there must be a circular reference.
1460         if (batch.length === 0) {
1461           return AV.Promise.error(
1462             new AV.Error(AV.Error.OTHER_CAUSE,
1463                             "Tried to save a batch with a cycle."));
1464         }
1465 
1466         // Reserve a spot in every object's save queue.
1467         var readyToStart = AV.Promise.when(_.map(batch, function(object) {
1468           return object._allPreviousSaves || AV.Promise.as();
1469         }));
1470         var batchFinished = new AV.Promise();
1471         AV._arrayEach(batch, function(object) {
1472           object._allPreviousSaves = batchFinished;
1473         });
1474 
1475         // Save a single batch, whether previous saves succeeded or failed.
1476         return readyToStart._continueWith(function() {
1477           return AV._request("batch", null, null, "POST", {
1478             requests: _.map(batch, function(object) {
1479               var json = object._getSaveJSON();
1480               var method = "POST";
1481 
1482               var path = "/1.1/classes/" + object.className;
1483               if (object.id) {
1484                 path = path + "/" + object.id;
1485                 method = "PUT";
1486               }
1487 
1488               object._startSave();
1489 
1490               return {
1491                 method: method,
1492                 path: path,
1493                 body: json
1494               };
1495             })
1496 
1497           }).then(function(response, status, xhr) {
1498             var error;
1499             AV._arrayEach(batch, function(object, i) {
1500               if (response[i].success) {
1501                 object._finishSave(
1502                   object.parse(response[i].success, status, xhr));
1503               } else {
1504                 error = error || response[i].error;
1505                 object._cancelSave();
1506               }
1507             });
1508             if (error) {
1509               return AV.Promise.error(
1510                 new AV.Error(error.code, error.error));
1511             }
1512 
1513           }).then(function(results) {
1514             batchFinished.resolve(results);
1515             return results;
1516           }, function(error) {
1517             batchFinished.reject(error);
1518             return AV.Promise.error(error);
1519           });
1520         });
1521       });
1522     }).then(function() {
1523       return object;
1524     });
1525   };
1526 
1527 };
1528
